title: Refactor Forge AI homepage into 3-section, high-density conversion layout with optimized motion/performance

requirements.text: Refactor `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to render exactly 3 major homepage sections in this order (and remove all other current homepage sections): (1) Hero + value + primary CTA (merged), (2) How Forge works (Accordion preferred), (3) Live marketplace preview + final CTA (merged).

quotes: Final sections should be: Hero + Value + CTA / Capabilities (Accordion) / Marketplace + Final CTA
Entire homepage = 2–3 screens total… Create more than 3 major homepage sections

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the homepage shows only 3 major sections (Hero, How it works accordion, Marketplace preview + final CTA).
All removed sections/components are no longer imported or rendered from `ForgeHomePage.tsx` (e.g., persona blocks, future vision/narrative sections, extra marketing blocks).
The homepage content fits within ~2–3 typical laptop/desktop screens at 100% zoom (no long narrative scroll).

requirements.text: Update the Hero section in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to follow the required hero rules: remove `min-h-screen`; use `py-16 md:py-20`; set hero container width to `max-w-5xl`; include Forge brand mark, a single H1 that contains an "agent marketplace / capability marketplace / autonomous AI agents" keyword concept, a one-line product definition, outcome-driven supporting copy, two primary CTAs ("Explore Agents" and "Enter Marketplace"), and secondary CTAs ("Build Agent" and "Start Building"); add a light trust/credibility signal within the hero (not as an extra large section).

quotes: SECTION 1 — HERO + VALUE + PRIMARY CTA (MERGED)… Must Include… One-line Product Definition… Two primary CTAs… Light trust or credibility signal
Layout Rules DO NOT USE: min-h-screen; USE: py-16 md:py-20
Hero Must Contain H1 with primary keyword concept… No duplicate H1 usage

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section does not use `min-h-screen` and uses `py-16 md:py-20`.
Hero content is constrained to `max-w-5xl` and CTAs are visible within the first screen on common viewport sizes.
There is exactly one H1 on the homepage and it includes a primary keyword concept (e.g., capability marketplace / agent marketplace / autonomous AI agents).
Hero includes: brand mark, one-line definition, outcome-driven message, 2 primary CTAs (Explore Agents, Enter Marketplace), and 2 secondary CTAs (Build Agent, Start Building).
A trust/credibility element is present in the hero (e.g., short compliance/trust bullets or metrics) without adding a new major homepage section.

requirements.text: Implement Section 2 as a compact "How Forge Works" accordion (mobile-first) with exactly the three required capability pillars: (1) Agent Discovery, (2) Workflow Orchestration, (3) Trust + Settlement. Apply layout rules: `max-w-4xl` and `py-14 md:py-16`. Ensure keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes are correct for the accordion triggers/content.

quotes: SECTION 2 — HOW FORGE WORKS (ACCORDION OR TABS)… Accordion preferred for mobile… Required Capability Pillars…
Layout Rules Max width: max-w-4xl; Padding: py-14 md:py-16
ARIA labels on interactive components; Accordion keyboard navigation

acceptanceCriteria: Section 2 uses an accordion UI (preferred) and contains exactly three items: Agent Discovery, Workflow Orchestration, Trust + Settlement.
Section 2 container is `max-w-4xl` and spacing is `py-14 md:py-16`.
Accordion can be operated fully with keyboard (tab/focus + enter/space) and does not fail accessibility checks for basic ARIA semantics.

requirements.text: Implement Section 3 as a merged "Live marketplace" preview with contextual placeholder data (no backend dependency) plus a visually dominant final CTA. Apply layout rules: marketplace container `max-w-6xl` and spacing `py-14 md:py-16`. Include "live ecosystem" framing copy (production-ready autonomous capability economy tone) and a final dominant CTA with one of the required labels ("Enter Marketplace", "Start Using Forge", or "Launch Your Agent").

quotes: SECTION 3 — LIVE MARKETPLACE + FINAL CTA (MERGED)… Must Include Marketplace preview component… “Live ecosystem” framing… Final CTA Must be visually dominant
Place holder with contextual placeholder data

acceptanceCriteria: Section 3 includes a marketplace preview UI populated from in-file placeholder data (e.g., sample agents/capabilities/ratings/pricing/settlement readiness) and does not require any backend calls to render.
Section 3 uses `max-w-6xl` and `py-14 md:py-16`.
A visually dominant final CTA is present and uses one of the specified labels; clicking navigates to an appropriate existing route (e.g., `/marketplace`).

requirements.text: Apply global spacing/container rules across the homepage refactor: replace any `py-20 md:py-28` with `py-14 md:py-16` for non-hero sections; ensure hero uses `py-16 md:py-20`; use `max-w-5xl` for hero, `max-w-4xl` for the accordion content section, and `max-w-6xl` for the marketplace preview section.

quotes: Replace Everywhere py-20 md:py-28 With py-14 md:py-16
Container Rules Hero: max-w-5xl; Content: max-w-4xl; Marketplace: max-w-6xl

acceptanceCriteria: No homepage sections (other than hero) use `py-20 md:py-28`.
Hero uses `py-16 md:py-20` and `max-w-5xl` container; Section 2 uses `max-w-4xl`; Section 3 uses `max-w-6xl`.

requirements.text: Reduce homepage motion/observer cost by removing unnecessary `useSectionEntryMotion` usages and intersection-triggered animations for deleted sections; keep motion only for: hero entrance, capabilities/how-it-works reveal, and final CTA emphasis. Ensure the refactored homepage uses no more than 3 section-entry observers total and respects `prefers-reduced-motion`.

quotes: Reduce motion observers by 50–70%… Remove unnecessary intersection triggers
KEEP Motion On Hero entrance… Capabilities section reveal… Final CTA emphasis
REMOVE Motion From Narrative storytelling sections… Long feature marketing blocks

acceptanceCriteria: `ForgeHomePage.tsx` registers at most 3 `useSectionEntryMotion` observers (or equivalent section-entry observers).
Deleted narrative/persona/future-vision sections do not retain any motion hooks/observers.
When the OS/browser has reduced motion enabled, sections render without requiring intersection entry to become visible.

requirements.text: Ensure semantic structure, accessibility, and SEO safety on the refactored homepage: use `<main>` containing `<section>` elements; no duplicate H1; use meaningful headings (H2/H3) per section; add ARIA labels where needed on interactive CTAs/controls; maintain WCAG AA contrast for text and interactive elements.

quotes: Must Include: Semantic landmarks: <header> <main> <section> <footer>
Hero Must Contain H1… No duplicate H1 usage
Minimum contrast ratio WCAG AA
ARIA labels on interactive components

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage has exactly one H1 and a logical heading hierarchy for subsequent sections.
Interactive elements (CTAs, accordion triggers) have accessible names and are keyboard reachable.
No structural accessibility regressions introduced by the refactor (landmarks and sections remain semantic).

requirements.text: Follow technical safety rule for imports in the homepage refactor: avoid non-guaranteed path aliases; use relative imports in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` (including for shadcn accordion components) unless the project’s alias configuration is already confirmed working for Vite builds.

quotes: If using aliases… ensure config exists… If not guaranteed → use relative imports only.

acceptanceCriteria: `ForgeHomePage.tsx` builds without path resolution errors in Vite.
If aliases are not guaranteed, accordion and other imports are expressed with relative paths.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Backend must remain single-actor; no new backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing real marketplace data fetching or integrating new backend endpoints for the marketplace preview (placeholder data only).
Adding additional homepage sections beyond the required 3 major sections.
Introducing heavy parallax, full-viewport lock sections, autoplay-heavy animation, or multiple stacked motion wrappers.
